channel.title: Gran Turismo 5
channel.description: Well the release of the latest game in the biggest name in racing games is drawing closer, I'm not sure if there is definitive release date yet or even what year its going to be released but i am hyped up about it already and the trailers that have been released are nothing short of perfectly rendered automotive pornpgraphy, those of you that have a PS3 and a 1080p TV should go and download the trailer from PSN and watch it in its full glory. But that latest trailer from this years E3 can be found here in HD for you as well http://www.videogamer.com/videos/gran_turismo_5_e3_09_trailer.html# this game is going to dominate the racing market there will be nothing like it. I really can't wait for this to hit the shelves.

@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Wow. So damn realistic. I don’t have a PS3 and now I see what you mean when you said PS3 sales are going to go sky high. This game really makes me want to buy one.

item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323

@chrisn2323 wrote:

eczema3:

Gran Turismo will always be the greatest virtual driving simulator of all time, ever.

gt3 was classic but gt4 sucked.

item.title: Gran Turismo 5
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Thug-life:

And this is the first Gran turismo where they have proper damage on the cars, though - some manufacturers have said they don’t want damage on their cars due to how realisitic they were making it happen, so they did say it may be limited real racing cars.

i dont understand why they wouldnt want the damage, its not like people are going to think ‘wow that looks sexy with a huge dent in it, i’ll go do that to my ferrari’ i cant think of a possible reason why they wouldnt want it to happen, if anything they should be encouraging it as NCAP dont test high end cars and if the physics in this aer good enough this could be a realistic simulation of what would happen if they crashed

Read full topic

item.title: Gran Turismo 5
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

eczema3:

It’s been in development so long, so long infact that the Prologue has been reduced to < £10 in most game shops.

I found it funny how so many people (sort of retarded) actually thought that Gran Turismo Prologue was the actual game and was the 5th instalment in the series. I find it funny how they completely ignored the fact that the word prologue was in the title. On the other hand, even that game is as rewarding or even better than most full games.

Gran Turismo > Forza Motorsport

Read full topic

item.title: Gran Turismo 5
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:282303”]It looks brilliant but how long have we actually been waiting for?

I can now see sales of the PS3 go sky high after the release of this game. Sony really needed a game like this to attract attention just like Halo 3 did for the Xbox 360.[/quote]
yeah, halo 3 boosted the X360 sales when it was released. I was watching an interview with someone from Nintendo and they had Mario kart, wii fit and super smash bros as they sales booster and they expected their current slump in sales unil later this year when they have another triple bill coming. It is indeed the software that sells the hardware.

Read full topic
